fathers.name: Per Henrik Ling
fathers.description: Developed a system of medical gymnastics emphasizing exercises and manipulations to restore physical health; influenced early therapeutic exercise methods.

fathers.name: Mary McMillan
fathers.description: Organized and professionalized physical therapy in the U.S., establishing WWI rehabilitation protocols and advocating for practitioner training and standards.

fathers.name: Hippocrates
fathers.description: Laid the foundations of clinical observation and rational treatment that later informed principles used in physical therapy.
